revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=November 2013}} {{Infobox civilian attack | title = Iranian embassy bombings | partof = [[Syrian civil war spillover in Lebanon]] | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | map = Beirut in Lebanon.svg | map_size = | map_alt = | map_caption = Location of Beirut in Lebanon | location = Jinah, [[Beirut]], Lebanon | target = Iranian embassy, Beirut | coordinates = {{coord|33|51|21.55|N|35|29|21.92|E|type:event_scale:50000_region:LB|format=dms|display=inline,title}} | date = {{start date|2013|11|19|df=yes}} | time = | timezone = [[Eastern European Time|EET]] | type = [[Suicide bomber]], [[car bomb]] | fatalities = 23 | injuries = 160[http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/beirut-bomb-blasts-kill-23-iranian-embassy-is-the-target-in-a-widening-war-between-shia-and-sunni-8948809.html Beirut bomb blasts kill 23: Iranian Embassy is the target in a widening war between Shia and Sunni] ''The Independent'' Retrieved 20 November 2013 | victims = | perps = | perpetrators = [[Abdullah Azzam Shaheed Brigade|Abdullah Azzam Brigades]] ([[al-Qaeda]] affiliate)
[[Al Mukhabarat Al A'amah]] (Hezbollah claim) | susperps = | weapons = | numparts = | dfens = | motive = }} {{Campaignbox Syrian civil war}} {{Campaignbox Syrian civil war spillover in Lebanon}} The '''Iranian embassy bombing''' was a double [[suicide bombing]] that occurred in front of the [[List of diplomatic missions of Iran|Iranian embassy]] in [[Beirut]], [[Lebanon]] on 19 November 2013. The two bombings resulted in 23 deaths{{cite news|date=19 November 2013|title=Nearly two dozen die in blasts in Beirut|url=http://www.presstv.ir/detail/2013/11/19/335436/seven-killed-in-beirut-blast/|publisher=Press TV|accessdate=19 November 2013}}{{cite news|date=19 November 2013|title=Lebanon blasts hit Iran's embassy in Beirut|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-24997876|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=19 November 2013}}{{cite news |date=19 November 2013|title=Beirut bombs kill 23; blasts linked to Syrian civil war |url=http://www.cnn.com/2013/11/19/world/meast/lebanon-beirut-explosion/|publisher=CNN}} and injured at least 160 others. ==Background== The bombings were seen as part of the [[Syrian civil war spillover in Lebanon|spillover]] of the [[Syrian Civil War]], in which [[Hezbollah]] and [[Iran]] have supported the Syrian government, while the [[Abdullah Azzam Brigades]] have fought against the Syrian government.{{cite journal|author=Bill Roggio|url=http://www.longwarjournal.org/archives/2012/06/abdullah_azzam_briga.php|title=Abdullah Azzam Brigades names leader, advises against attacks in Syria's cities|work=The Long War Journal|date=27 June 2012|accessdate=13 October 2012}} On the same day as the bombing, Syrian government forces seized the town of [[Qarah, Syria|Qarah]] from rebel fighters in an opening action in the [[Battle of Qalamoun]].{{cite news|title=Syrian army takes town along north-south highway: state media |url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2013/11/19/us-syria-crisis-town-idUSBRE9AI0FX20131119|agency= Reuters|date=19 November 2013 |accessdate=19 November 2013}} The Syrian government effort at the time to eliminate the rebel stronghold in Qalamoun, a region along the Lebanese border with strong ties to the [[Sunni Islam in Lebanon|Lebanese Sunni]] town of [[Arsal]], with strong support of Hezbollah fighters, was expected by some analysts to raise tensions within Lebanon.[http://english.alarabiya.net/en/News/middle-east/2013/10/31/Hezbollah-deploys-15-000-troops-for-anticipated-Qalamoun-battle.html Hezbollah deploys 15,000 troops for anticipated Qalamoun battle] Al Arabiya. 1 November 2013. Retrieved 20 November 2013 ==Bombings== The area immediately outside the embassy gates was hit by two consecutive blasts. The first was reported to be carried out by a bomber either on a motorcycle{{cite web|title=Devastating blasts hit Iran embassy in Beirut|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2013/11/explosion-hits-southern-beirut-201311198526989749.html|publisher=Al Jazeera|accessdate=19 November 2013|date=19 November 2013}} or on foot. After people had rushed to the scene, a 4x4 vehicle two buildings away from the embassy blew up in a second, deadlier explosion. The two blasts occurred within 2 minutes of each other.[http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-25000329 Lebanon blasts hit Iran's embassy in Beirut: As it happened] BBC News 20 November 2013 Six buildings were reported to have been damaged. The bombs destroyed some building fronts and severely damaged the embassy gates, but caused only fairly minor damage to the embassy building. ===Victims=== According to Lebanon's [[Ministry of Health (Lebanon)|Health Ministry]] at least 23 people were killed and 147 wounded. Iranian cultural attaché Ebrahim Ansari was among the dead, with five Iranian security personnel wounded.{{cite web|last=Saigol|first=Lina|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/ea0bfb2e-50f5-11e3-b499-00144feabdc0.html#axzz2l8KMFPL7|title=Twin explosions leave 23 dead near Iran's embassy in Beirut|work=Financial Times|date=22 October 2013|accessdate=19 November 2013}} Ansari and the Iranian ambassador [[Ghazanfar Roknabadi]] were scheduled to leave the embassy to attend a meeting at the [[Ministry of Culture (Lebanon)|Ministry of Culture]] at around the time when the bombs went off. The embassy's head of security, a Lebanese national, was also killed in the blast.{{cite news|url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/world/middle_east/lebanons-hezbollah-holds-funeral-for-iran-embassy-bombing-dead-pledges-continued-syria-fight/2013/11/20/cff92e58-5223-11e3-9ee6-2580086d8254_story.html|title=Lebanon's Hezbollah holds funeral for Iran Embassy bombing dead, pledges continued Syria fight|work=The Washington Post|date=21 November 2013|accessdate=21 November 2013}} ==Claims of responsibility== The [[Abdullah Azzam Shaheed Brigade|Abdullah Azzam Brigades]], a [[Sunni]] [[Islamism|Islamist]] militant group, claimed responsibility for the attack. The group declared that its attacks against Iran would continue until Iran "withdraws its forces from Syria".{{cite news|title=Suicide bombings kill 23 near Iran embassy in Beirut|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2013/11/19/us-lebanon-blast-idUSBRE9AI08G20131119|accessdate=19 November 2013|agency=Reuters|date=19 November 2013|author=Laila Bassam|author2=Erica Solomon|location=Beirut}}{{cite news|title=Beirut probes Iranian embassy bomb attack|url=http://www.euronews.com/2013/11/20/beirut-probes-iranian-embassy-bomb-attack/|accessdate=20 November 2013|work=Euronews|date=20 November 2013}} The group has made false claims in the past. On December 31, sources confirmed that Lebanese authorities have captured Majid bin Mohammad al-Majid, the Saudi leader of the Abdullah Azzam Brigades.{{cite news|title=Ghosn confirms chief of Al-Qaeda-linked group arrested|url=http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Lebanon-News/2014/Jan-01/242826-ghosn-confirms-chief-of-al-qaeda-linked-group-arrested.ashx|newspaper=[[The Daily Star (Lebanon)|The Daily Star]]|accessdate=1 January 2014|date=1 January 2014}}{{cite news|last=Hosenball|first=Mark|title=Leader of group linked to al Qaeda held in Lebanon: sources|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2013/12/31/us-usa-lebanon-idUSBRE9BU0I920131231|accessdate=1 January 2014|newspaper=[[Reuters]]|date=31 December 2013|author2=Alistair Bell|author3=Andrew Hay}} Leader of Hezbollah [[Hassan Nasrallah]] said in December television interview that the attack was "linked to the [[Al Mukhabarat Al A'amah|Saudi intelligence services]]" because of "Saudi Arabia's rage against Iran over (Saudi Arabia's) failure" in Syria.{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-25210712|title=Saudis behind blasts at Iran embassy, Hezbollah says|publisher=BBC News|date=2013-12-04|accessdate=2013-12-04}} ==Reactions== ;Domestic Hezbollah held a public funeral and rally in Beirut the day after the attack. Hezbollah deputy leader [[Naim Qassem]] vowed to continue support for the Syrian government in saying the attacks in Lebanon were "inevitable pains on the road to victory", while mourners chanted "[[Death to America]], Israel, and the [[takfiri]]s!" ;Regional Iranian foreign ministry spokeswoman [[Marzieh Afkham]] blamed Israel for the attack, calling it "an inhuman crime and spiteful act done by Zionists and their mercenaries".{{cite news|date=19 November 2013|title=Iran accuses Israel of being behind Beirut bombings|url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5i4qQkAaNhHyPSGa0H6k0G3WEp92g?docId=9a8c3ea3-a082-4906-a27c-4e491ba8e09e|agency=Agence France-Presse}}{{cite news|title=With Beirut bombing, Iran takes direct hit for helping Assad|url=http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Security-Watch/2013/1119/With-Beirut-bombing-Iran-takes-direct-hit-for-helping-Assad-video|accessdate=20 November 2013|work=The Christian Science Monitor|date=19 November 2013|author=Rebecca Collard|location=Beirut}} [[Israel]] denied any involvement.{{cite web|url=http://rt.com/news/iran-beirut-attack-israel-952/|title=Iran blames Israel for Beirut blasts as Al-Qaeda offshoot lays claim|work=RT News|date=19 November 2013}} Saudi Arabia called on all its citizens to leave the country.[http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2013/11/saudi-arabia-urges-citizens-leave-lebanon-20131121141951430884.html Saudi Arabia urges citizens leave Lebanon] Al Jazeera 21 November 2013 ;Other states and entities The attacks were condemned by the [[United Nations Security Council]], China,[http://www.fmprc.gov.cn/eng/xwfw/s2510/t1100924.shtml Foreign Ministry Spokesperson Hong Lei's Regular Press Conference on 20 November 2013] Foreign Ministry of China 20 November 2013 France, Syria, the United Kingdom and the United States. [[Tom Fletcher (diplomat)|Tom Fletcher]], the British ambassador to Beirut, personally [[Blood donation|donated blood]] and expressed solidarity with those affected. ==See also== {{portal|Iran|Lebanon|Syrian civil war}} * [[Iran–Lebanon relations]] * [[List of attacks on diplomatic missions]] * [[1983 United States embassy bombing]] * [[Iranians in Lebanon]] * [[Ghazanfar Roknabadi]] ==References== {{reflist|3}} ==External links== * [http://www.iranianembassy.gov.lb/?lan=En Iranian embassy in Lebanon] {{Syrian Civil War}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Iranian embassy bombing}} [[Category:2013 in Lebanon]] [[Category:Attacks on diplomatic missions of Iran]] [[Category:Attacks on diplomatic missions in Lebanon]] [[Category:Terrorist incidents in Lebanon during the Syrian Civil War]] [[Category:Car and truck bombings in Lebanon]] [[Category:Iran–Lebanon relations]] [[Category:Mass murder in 2013]] [[Category:Suicide bombings in Lebanon]] [[Category:Terrorist incidents in Lebanon in 2013]] [[Category:Terrorist incidents in Beirut]] [[Category:21st century in Beirut]]
